item.title: Debunked: Several Foreign Media Outlets Today Reported "China Again Bans Cryptocurrency Trading and Mining," Which May Be Misinformation
item.description: August 3rd. Today, numerous overseas media and KOLs, such as Kalshi, First Squawk, and The ETF Store President Nate Geraci, reported on the so-called "China Just Announced Officially Banning Cryptocurrency Trading and Mining" news. BlockBeats has obtained information from multiple sources that up to now, there has been no recent ban announced.In fact, as early as May 19, 2021, China had already completely prohibited cryptocurrency mining activities.

item.title: Some Altcoins Show Strong Rebound, CFX Surges Over 5% in Nearly 2 Hours
item.description: On August 3rd, according to HTX market data, several altcoins witnessed significant growth along with the market's rebound. These include:CFX surged by more than 5% in the past 2 hours and is currently trading at $0.2009;RSC achieved a 22.9% increase in the past 24 hours and is now trading at $0.6493;TROLL saw a 19.1% increase in the past 24 hours and is now trading at $0.08076.

item.title: Hong Kong Legislator: Stablecoins Have No Pump-and-Dump Opportunity, Regulations Reference Industry Practices in the US, Japan, and EU
item.description: August 3rd. Ted Hui, a member of the Hong Kong Legislative Council, stated in an interview that the core characteristic of a fiat-backed stablecoin is that it must be backed by highly liquid fiat reserves at a rate of 100%. Currently, the main function of a fiat-backed stablecoin is still international payments, and there is no chance for speculation.During the formulation of the "Stablecoin Regulations", references were made to the United States, Japan, and the EU's MiCA (Markets in Crypto-Assets) regulation, as well as Singapore's Payment Service Act (PSA). The legislation takes into account international circulation and demand and adheres to both international and national standards. Additionally, Hui also mentioned that Hong Kong's stablecoin should not compete for market share with existing products but should explore new markets. (Daily Economic News)

item.title: On August 1st, the entire network experienced a long liquidation of 920 million US dollars, marking the largest long liquidation day since February 25th.
item.description: August 3rd. Based on Coinglass data, on August 1st, the total liquidation of long positions across the entire network reached $9.222 billion, which was the largest day for long liquidation since February 25th of this year.It is worthy of note that after February 25th, the market entered a consolidation phase that lasted for more than two months.

item.title: A whale went long on Bitcoin with 40x leverage and set a take-profit point at $125,000
item.description: On August 3rd, based on LookOnChain's monitoring, Whale 0xab15 established a 40x leveraged long position in Bitcoin. The position value was 400 BTC (equivalent to $45.37 million), and a take-profit price was set at $125,000.

item.title: The whale who last accumulated ETH two years ago has re-entered the market. Over the past week, they have accumulated 6711.2 ETH at an approximate cost of 3685.4 USD.
item.description: On August 3rd, according to on-chain analyst Ai Auntie (@ai_9684xtpa), an address (0x5Fe) that had been reaccumulating ETH after two years withdrew another 3000 ETH from Binance two hours ago. On July 28th, this address accumulated 3711 ETH at a price of $3,912. Over the past week, it has accumulated a total of 6711.2 ETH (approximately $24.73 million) with an average cost of around $3,685.4. Currently, it is facing an unrealized loss of $1.654 million.

item.title: A whale deposited 7500 ETH into a CEX 5 hours ago and has sold 33,682 ETH in the past 3 days.
item.description: On August 3rd, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, 5 hours ago, a whale transferred an additional 7,500 ETH ($25.58 million) to a centralized exchange. This brings the total amount of ETH sold by this whale in the past 3 days to 33,682 ETH ($119 million).

item.title: A whale's DOGE 10x long position was partially liquidated this morning during the price drop
item.description: On August 3rd, as per the monitoring of Onchain Lens, with the market declining, a whale's long position in DOGE (with a multiple of 10) was partially liquidated. Up to now, this transaction has led to a loss of $3.09 million.

item.title: Ethereum's largest whale address BMNR has seen its unrealized loss ratio exceed 9%, with an unrealized loss of nearly $200 million.
item.description: On August 3rd, according to Bitmine Immersion (BMNR), the largest holding institution of Ethereum, its total holdings of ETH amount to 625,000 ETH, and the overall average purchase price per ETH is approximately $3,755.Based on the current ETH price of $3,437, BMNR's unrealized loss percentage has reached 9.25%, with an unrealized loss of around $198.75 million.

item.title: Sam Altman: ChatGPT's new model is scheduled to be released in the coming months, but a capacity crisis may occur during this period
item.description: On August 3rd, the founder of ChatGPT, Sam Altman, posted on the X platform, stating that new models, products, and features, etc. may be launched in the coming months. During this period, there may be some minor issues and capacity crises. Although there may be some instability, the market is expected to be able to accept the upcoming new products.
